thread.title: J.W. Anderson Was as Wacky as It’s Ever Been for FW17
thread.title_full: J.W. Anderson Was as Wacky as It’s Ever Been for FW17

author: Alec Leach
title: J.W. Anderson Was as Wacky as It’s Ever Been for FW17
text:
Visit the original post to see all 18 images from this gallery. 
Even among all the wacky runway creations that make London Fashion Week Men’s the spectacle that it is, J.W. Anderson is something else. He’s a mad scientist experimenting in his lab, outfitting boys in gender-bending silhouettes, insane visual mashups and completely unrelated elements (previous seasons have seen spray-painted aprons worn with steampunk goggles and crowns made from building blocks).
For FW17, the Northern Irishman developed a fascination with the Middle Ages. He used crochet knits, images taken from stained-glass windows and patches of heraldry like the ones knights would wear back in the day. Not exactly instantly wearable ideas, but Anderson’s appeal is never obvious.
Dig a little deeper, and you’d see some eerily charming ideas peeking through the cracks. Massively oversized knits, allover print tees, patched cardigans and bombers sporting heraldry shields would all keep the buyers happy, even if the show did feel like a no-holds-barred assault on the eyes — which it always does.
For the latest collections, street style and trends, check out the rest of our FW17 Fashion Week coverage.
